intro: Ballota glabriflora, commonly known as the hairy leaf ballota, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant features small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and its leaves are typically hairy, giving it its common name. Ballota glabriflora is known for its ability to thrive in rocky and dry environments. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in herbal medicine.
